subject: Ethics
title: Anatomy of a Ponzi Scheme
description: A 60-second lesson on Anatomy of a Ponzi Scheme.

hook.text: Bernie Madoff delivered steady 12% returns for 20 years. Not one trade was ever made. $65 billion vanished.

buildup.text: A Ponzi scheme pays old investors with new investors' money. There's no real profitâ€”just a transfer chain.

discovery.text: It works as long as new money flows in. The moment withdrawals exceed deposits, the whole structure collapses.

twist.text: Harry Markopolos warned the SEC about Madoff for nine years. They investigated and found nothing. Twice.

climax.text: Madoff's scheme lasted so long because his returns looked boringly consistent. The best cons don't look exciting.

punchline.text: If returns seem too steady, someone's making them up.

quiz.question: How does a Ponzi scheme generate 'returns' for investors?
options: By paying existing investors with money from new investors
By investing in high-risk international markets
